alert.note: Alert for Central Tangipahoa; East Baton Rouge; East Feliciana; Lower Tangipahoa; Northern Livingston; Northern St. Tammany; Northern Tangipahoa; Southern Livingston; Southwestern St. Tammany; St. Helena; Washington (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 28 at 5:15PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHERN ST. HELENA, NORTHWESTERN ST. TAMMANY, NORTHERN LIVINGSTON, SOUTHEASTERN EAST FELICIANA, TANGIPAHOA, NORTHEASTERN EAST BATON ROUGE AND SOUTHWESTERN WASHINGTON PARISHES THROUGH 545 PM CDT... At 514 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Montpelier, or 11 miles southwest of Amite. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Baton Rouge, Hammond, Zachary, Baker, Denham Springs, Covington, Clinton, Greensburg, Amite, Ponchatoula, Walker, Amite City, Abita Springs, Livingston, Independence, Roseland, Albany, Slaughter, Madisonville, and Folsom. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 12 between mile markers 8 and 68. Interstate 55 in Louisiana between mile markers 25 and 53. Interstate 110 in Louisiana between mile markers 2 and 7. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
